utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! I’m here!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, hang on!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Either this is the most boring dream I’ve ever had or you can’t sleep either.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s not a dream. More like a nightmare.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is this about your valedictorian speech?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s myturn to say something important. Something worthy. I don’t want to blow it; but I feel like I have nothing to say.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean nothing compared to the great scared texts of mankind, or … Winston Churchill’s speech to Harrow’s or Steve Job’s address to Stanford. You know, maybe you pick some speeches a little less daunting to compare yours to. Like um … Say Anything. Or Twilight!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s not supposed to be this hard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, the most worthwhile things in life are often the most difficult. For example, Wow. That really is a smart phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of course you don’t understand why she’s taking her graduation speech so seriously. You were probably the guy who had nothing on but boxers underneath

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is so insulting. If you must know, I was naked underneath.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I – I’m sorry. I stand corrected.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how is the father of the graduate taking it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I already have a plan to drown my sorrows, after the ceremony. My mother goes off to the Hamptons, Alexis will be doing her all-nighter. I will be distracting myself with a double feature of The Killer and Hard Boiled.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. That is a double feature.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You like John Woo?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The bloodier the better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You wouldn’t want to join me, would you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, I’d love to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You comin’, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Yes.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So we’ve got a Hispanic male, late 20s. Cabbie spotted the body about an hour ago and called it in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We get an ID?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, we checked his pockets, there’s no phone, keys, or wallet. We’re checking prints right now. From the blood trail it looks like he was shot before he entered the alley.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: He was hit in the shoulder with what looks like a 357, but the kill shot? Point blank, execution style with a 9 millimeter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Two guns? Could be more than one shooter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was CSU able to trace that blood trail from the first shot?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It starts around the corner. There’s no visible point of origin but the teams are still looking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well this is a bad neighborhood. Maybe it was a mugging gone wrong?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Maybe. These grooves in his shoulder indicate her was carrying something and it was heavy. I’d say at least 30 pounds. I’m even seeing traces of skin tissue in his fingernail. I may be able to get DNA but I’ll know a lot more once I get back to the morgue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh… His pockets may have been empty but it looks like he was trying to hide something in his shoe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lock picks?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now why would someone be needing lock picks?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: He’s a thief. Orlando Costas. Couple of domestic B and E’s, but suspected of a dozen more. He used to run with the Cazadores.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cazadores?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They’re a violent street gang that deals in drugs, arms, and larceny, but all of Orlando’s priors are back when he was a teenager. He hasn’t been arrested in years.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he got back in the game.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. He went a long way to clean up his act. Did 4 years active in the military, discharged with honors last year. Spent his rotation as an MP in Germany.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Military police? He really did clean up his act.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If this guy went straight then how did he end up dead in an alley? Did you check for next of kin?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, his folks are dead but we managed to track down a girlfriend, Marisol Cartagena. Esposito’s bringing her in right now.

utterance.speaker: MARISOL CARTAGENA
utterance.content: All I know is he was with me in bed last night when I went to sleep. I woke up this morning and both him and my car were gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did he go?

utterance.speaker: MARISOL
utterance.content: I figured he went to the career center to check the job listings. He does that every morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’d been looking for work.

utterance.speaker: MARISOL
utterance.content: For months. Orlando served his country. You’d think that means something, but it’s been tough. Especially after my hours got cut.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he was under financial pressure? Is it possible he went back to old habits?

utterance.speaker: MARISOL
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look Marisol, we know that he ran with the Cazadores. Do you think that –

utterance.speaker: MARISOL
utterance.content: I said no! He went through hell to escapes that life. It’s why he enlisted. To get out. To be a better man for me. A better father for his son. So how ‘bout to stop trying to make this his fault and find whoever killed him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of car do you have?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Two blocks away from the alley. Blood smeared on the armrest. This is definitely it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was shot somewhere else and then he came here? Why not go home? Why not go get patched up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was meeting someone in that alleyway.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Phone. His last call was 4:47AM just before he died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Run that number.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett. Gun. It’s a .38. Recently fired.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So it was a shootout. That’s how he got the shoulder wound.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means wherever he came from there might be another body.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I know where he was coming from.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His last entry was 299 First Avenue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What – what’s at 299 First Avenue?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Captain Montgomery’s house.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re just thankful no one was hurt.

utterance.speaker: EVELYN MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Believe me, so am I. Ever since Roy died I’ve slept with his .357 in the nightstand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it was just the one guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Evelyn, was this the guy?

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m glad Evan and the girls weren’t home.

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: Funny thing is, I wasn’t supposed to be home either. It’s almost like he knew we weren’t supposed to be here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything special about those files?

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: Just paperwork, legal documents, notes on Roy’s old cases.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about his computer? What was on that?

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: His old work files, but mostly I use it for Christmas cards and recipes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They went after Montgomery’s files. Not valuables, not cash. And now our thief is dead and the files they took are missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well let’s not jump to conclusions.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What else would it be about? Everyone else thinks Montgomery died bringing a cop killer to justice. We’re the only ones who know what he was really involved in. And his connection to your mother’s murder. Beckett, it can’t be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Recheck the victim’s rap sheet, see if Montgomery was involved in any of his old arrests and get on that number. I want to know who he was talking with just before he died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Say something reassuring.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There are thousands of break-ins in New York City every year.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This one feels different.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that doesn’t mean that it is. Montgomery worked hundreds of cases. Just because this guy goes after files doesn’t mean he was after your mom’s case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why is our thief dead? You know those guys Montgomery was involved with, he said that they wanted me dead. That I was getting too close and he said that he was going to give his life in order to protect mine. And they still tried to kill me. I wake up sometimes and I think to myself, “how the hell am I still alive?”. It’s like I’m just waiting for that other shoe to drop. What if this is that other shoe?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Things were finally getting better for her. For us. She was just coming out of her shell, and now this.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Do you really think it’s connected to her mother’s murder case?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I hope to God it isn’t. Montgomery’s friend was very clear. She starts poking around her mother’s murder, they’ll come after her again. I can’t let that happen.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you get any sleep?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not much.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything new on our victim?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We rechecked Orlando’s rap sheet. Montgomery wasn’t involved in any of his old arrests. That break-in wasn’t personal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about the call he made before he was killed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s from a burner phone. There’s no registered owner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not in this alone. I’m here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So we may have been wrong about why they hit Montgomery’s.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Witnesses saw a Hispanic male fleeing the alley in an old maroon DeVille. Apparently he had gang ink on his neck. A lion framed by a C.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cazadore?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The very same gang our victim ran with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gangs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If this guy was in that alley, odds are he killed Orlando.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did we get a license plate?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, no. But according to gang task force, the ride matches the car of one Vincente Delgato. High level shot caller for the Cazadores. And get this, his cousin, Diego Guetierrez, was busted by Montgomery for a double homicide in ’95.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His lawyers filed a motion for retrial a month after Montgomery was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Find him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD! Let me see your hands!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t move! Don’t move!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well lookie here. A 9millimeter. Just like the gun that killed Orlando Costas.

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: I already told you. I was nowhere near that alley. Fact is, your witnesses are blind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The fact is, you knew Orlando Costas.

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: Yeah, I knew him. Once. Before he turned his back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When was the last time you heard from him?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: Not in years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hours. Just before he was killed Orlando called a burner cell, same phone that we found on you. So why don’t you just admit to it and save yourself thirty years? You had him break in to Roy Montgomery’s house and steal your cousin’s case files and then you shot him.

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: What you got, chica? Huh? The gun’s not going to be a match. So that leaves you with what? A phone call? A couple people saw a very common car.

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: You want to know why you can’t pin this on me, chica? I wasn’t there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The hell you weren’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s gonna be ballistics. Last chance to make a deal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Book him on the drugs and weapons charge and tell the DA I’m going to want to file for murder 1.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It wasn’t him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean it wasn’t him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The skin tissue that Lanie was able to scrape from underneath our victim’s fingernails, the lab was able to pull DNA. We ran it against Vincente. It’s not a match. In fact, it wasn’t a match to anyone in the system.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But it did match DNA trace evidence found at another crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well at least that’s something. What was the crime scene?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was a shooting.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett, it was your shooting.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: DNA confirms that the man who killed Orlando Costas in that alley is the same man who put a bullet in your heart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No leads for 11 months and now this. Does Gates know?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then we don’t tell her. If she finds out this is a match to my shooting she’ll take me off the case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe you should be off this case. They tried to kill you once, Kate. You keep going on this they … what’s to keep them from trying again?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s to stop them now? No. I’ve been waiting a year for this and I’ll be damned if I let someone else screw it up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Javier. Man, this just feels wrong. We need to tell Gates.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why? So she can send Beckett home? You think that’s going to work? You think that’s going to stop her? She’s going to investigate this case, Kevin, whether she’s on it or not. The least we can do is have her back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s you. Thank God. What the hell is going on? Why did they break into Montgomery’s place?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: Well most likely it’s a cleanup job. Making sure that Montgomery had nothing else incriminating in his files. As long as Beckett drops her investigation we still hold all the cards.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No- she’s already onto her shooter. She’s not going to let go.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: Then we have a problem. If she doesn’t stop, they will retaliate. I can’t control the situation if you can’t control her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We got enough on the drugs and weapons charges to put you away for at least 5 years. Five years of your life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s that worth? I know you didn’t kill Orlando. But he called you and he talked to you for 2 minutes. And you were in that alley. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s nobody in here but you and me. There’s no cameras, no microphones. No one’s listening. I can make all those charges go away. Five years of your life back. But you gotta tell me what you know.

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: He called last week, talking about how times were bad. So I told him “I can get you some work”. But he knew if he came back to the Cazadores there’d be no leaving this time. And all he really wanted was a loan and could I help him out for old time’s sake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you give it to him?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: No. He begged me. Said he was good for it. Said he had something big coming up. Something that would make him whole.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he say what?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: No. But that morning my phone rings. And he said it had all gone wrong. He was desperate, talking about they want to kill him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s they?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: Don’t know. But he was scared.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why did he call you?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: Protection, chica. Said if I helped him out he’d come back. And he knew that was the price. So I told him where to meet. But by the time I got there he was already dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you told him where to meet?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you didn’t tell anyone else?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you see anything there?

utterance.speaker: DIEGO
utterance.content: White guy, 6 foot. Caught a glimpse before the night swallowed him whole.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They must have been tapping Orlando’s phone. That’s the only way they got there first. But how did they know to target Orlando for the job?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because he was desperate for money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but how did they know that? How did they know his background?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because they knew him from the military. He was hired by someone he knew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a place to start.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But whoever's gotten close to that secret is dead. I think it’s clear that we’re in over our heads here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Speak for yourself, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Orlando’s financials just came in. He was underwater and overdrawn, until last week when a wire transfer for $10 grand hit his account.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me guess. Untraceable?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So it’s a dead end.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The deposits are, but the debit withdrawals are not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right when the money came in Marisol started using it to pay bills.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, if Marisol knew about the money –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then she knew Orlando was up to something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She lied to us.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not only that, but according to the bank she cleaned out the entire account an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s on the run.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Got a few questions for you before you leave town and this time I want the truth.

utterance.speaker: MARISOL
utterance.content: I’m telling you the truth. I didn’t know anything about the money. Not until today.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why do we have debits against it the moment it appeared in your account.

utterance.speaker: MARISOL
utterance.content: Orlando –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was your card, Marisol! Who was Orlando working for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know what’s going to happen if you don’t cooperate? You’re going to go to jail and your kid’s going to go to foster care. Is that what you want?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Marco, on the streets, enlisted by the Cazadores at age 10 like his father. Dead, in a gutter, at 19!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett! That’s enough.

utterance.speaker: MARISOL
utterance.content: Orlando said it was someone he knew from the service. Someone dangerous. But it was just a one off. A lot of money for an easy job. And we needed the money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was the job?

utterance.speaker: MARISOL
utterance.content: They needed files. From a dead cop’s house.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What files?

utterance.speaker: MARISOL
utterance.content: All of them. Any he could find.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This guy from the service, did you get a name?

utterance.speaker: MARISOL
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you meet him?

utterance.speaker: MARISOL
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he ever call the house?

utterance.speaker: MARISOL
utterance.content: He left notes for Orlando in a mailbox with a time and a place. They were coded so I wouldn’t know where. But I was in the car once. I saw where they met. At a church, over on State Street.

utterance.speaker: PRIEST
utterance.content: Wednesday you say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, around 3PM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well he was meeting with someone?

utterance.speaker: PRIEST
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I wish I could help. But we’re open to the public and we get a lot of unfamiliar faces every day. We usually just leave them to their prayers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If your donation box is any indication it looks like being open to the public comes with a price.

utterance.speaker: PRIEST
utterance.content: Yes well, it’s not the best neighborhood. We catch gang kids and the homeless all the time trying to take advantage of more than just our outreach programs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you catch them?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here it is, 3PM Wednesday.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There’s Orlando.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s him

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, c’mon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So that’s what you look like.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m going to run this through the army CID. If they met in the military someone in Orlando’s old unit might be able to ID him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. No, we don’t know who’s involved and we don’t know how high this goes. The minute we put this photo out there people are going to know. He’s going to disappear and we will never see him again. We have to do this one on our own.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett, that’s impossible. All we have is a face. No name, no ID, no way to find this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then we’ll find a way to find him. I’m not going to lose this lead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How are we supposed to investigate if we can’t investigate?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You heard the lady. We find a way.

utterance.speaker: MCCALISTER
utterance.content: You woke the dragon. And this is so much bigger than you realize.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can’t hide from me.

utterance.speaker: LOCKWOOD
utterance.content: You got that ass-backwards. You can’t hide from him.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I don’t know how but someone he figured out …

utterance.speaker: RAGLAN
utterance.content: I made a bad mistake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who hired you to kill her?

utterance.speaker: DICK COONAN
utterance.content: Forget it. You’ll never touch him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I just got off the phone with Esposito. Our killer had a keychain and he matched it to Eastway Car Rentals.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That could be any one of a thousand cars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know it’s a needle in a haystack but at least it’s a haystack. And they keep most of their licenses on file.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s probably using a fake ID, but we should be able to narrow it down from there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You, um … You have to stop. This investigation. You- you have to stop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we already talked about this. I’m fine. I’m in control.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, you’re not. They are. And if you don’t stop, they will kill you, Kate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Before Montgomery went into that hangar, he sent a package to someone. Someone he trusted. It contained information damaging to the person behind all this. Montgomery was trying to protect you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But the package didn’t arrive until after you had been shot. Montgomery’s friend struck a deal with them. If they left you alone, that package and the information inside would never see the light of day. But they made one condition. You had to back off. And that’s the reason you’re alive, Kate. Because you stopped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In order for the deal to work, someone had to make sure you weren’t pursuing it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you a part of this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was just trying to keep you safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By lying to me about the most important thing in my life?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That lie was the only thing protecting you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I didn’t need protection. I needed a lead. And you sat on it for a year. Now, who is this person? How do I find him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s … a voice on the phone. He’s a shadow in a parking garage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You met with him? How do you know he’s not behind my mom’s murder? How do you know that he’s not involved and how the hell could you do this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because I love you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you already know that, don’t you? You’ve known for about a year.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? You’re actually bringing this up right now? After you told me that you just betrayed me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate, listen to me –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen to you? Why should I listen to you? How am I even supposed to trust anything that you say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How are you – Because of everything we’ve been through together! Four years I’ve been right here! Four years, just waiting for you to open your eyes and see that I’m right here. And that I’m more than a partner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Every morning I- I bring you a cup of coffee just so that I can see a smile on your face because I think you are the most remarkable, maddening, challenging, frustrating person I have ever met. And I love you Kate, and if that means anything to you, if you care about me at all, just don’t do this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If I care about you, Castle, you cut a deal for my life like I’m some kind of a child. My life. Mine. You don’t get to decide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You keep going with this? They’re going to decide. They’re going to come for you, Kate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let them come! They sent Coonan and he is dead. They sent Lockwood and he is dead and I am still here, Castle! And I am ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ready for what? To die for your cause? This isn’t a murder investigation anymore, Kate. They’ve turned it into a war.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If they want a war then I will bring them a war. Straight to their doorsteps.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then I guess there’s just nothing I can say, is there? Okay, um… Yeah, you’re right, Kate. It’s your life. You can throw it away if you want but I’m not going to stick around and watch you so this is um… over. I’m done.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, fine. How’s your speech coming?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I have watched or read every graduation address ever written and compiled all the best advice into one speech. And then I read it out loud. And guess what I sounded like? A pompous ass. I’m 18 years old. What the hell do I know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, hey. Look. Everything you know, everything you will know is – is what’s true for you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: All I know is everything’s changing. Everything’s going to be different. And I’m so scared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Moving on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right about that. That feels true.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where’s Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s off the team.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what do we got?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Eastway rented 700 cars last Wednesday.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We believe our suspect is going under the name Cole Maddox. He rented out of JFK.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s a Kansas driver’s license. Now we did some digging. It’s a cover ID.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he return the car?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. But Eastway maintains GPS tracking on all of its equipment, so we tracked it to the lower East Side. A one block radius somewhere along here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. You stay on grid, let us know if he moves. Esposito you’re coming with me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. What are you doing? You want to do this, you do it right. You put a team on that car and you bring backup with you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, this whole thing started because of a group of corrupt cops. How do you know there aren’t more out there. We’re about an inch away from catching this guy. And I’m not going to blow it by advertising our next move.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: With all due respect, this guy put a bullet in your heart and then he disappeared into the ether. You cannot go in there unprepared.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unprepared? I’ve been preparing for this for the past 13 years.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait, Javier! Man, don’t let her do this. It’s too big of a risk.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s all good, bro. We got this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon! We don’t want to miss her speech! Or the entire graduation.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I’m almost ready.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey! We got him. The doorman at the residency hotel across the way ID’d the car and the front desk clerk confirms Mr. Maddox is here on a one month lease. They’ve agreed to let us in his room.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Get out of the way.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Montgomery’s files.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s a contact list. What the hell were they looking for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not what. Who. They grabbed Montgomery’s wedding album.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re looking for someone that he knew.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe they found him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We gotta get out of here. I’m going to call for backup, we’ll set up a –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just tell me who’s behind this.

utterance.speaker: COLE MADDOX
utterance.content: You’re wasting your time, Detective. You have no idea what you’re up against.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Neither do you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Help! Help!

utterance.speaker: MADDOX
utterance.content: Actually, we know exactly who we’re up against.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Help!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, oh God. No! Not like this. C’mon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, no!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m here! No! Oh, God. Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, hang on!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN GATES
utterance.content: Withholding evidence, lying to a superior officer? What you did dishonors this city and dishonors the badge. Not only are you off this investigation, I’m putting you both on administrative leave effective immediately.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Don’t you sir me. You don’t deserve to wear the uniform. Now, hand over your badges and guns.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Keep it. I resign.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: There’s a universal truth that we have to face, whether we want to or not. Everything eventually ends. As much as I’ve looked forward to this day, I’ve always disliked endings.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The end of summer, the final chapter of a great book, parting ways with a close friend. But endings are inevitable.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi? I had to.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Leaves fall, we close the book, you say goodbye.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Today is one of those days for us. Today we say goodbye to everything that was familiar. Everything that was comfortable.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We’re moving on. But just because we’re leaving, and that hurts, there are some people who are so much a part of us they’ll be with us no matter what. They are our solid ground.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Our north star. And the small clear voices in our hearts that will be with us. Always.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No Alexis, I’ll be fine. I’ve got a thousand cable channels, I’ve got my X-box. You have fun. I will not worry about you until lunchtime tomorrow. I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, what do you want?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m so sorry, Castle. I’m so sorry. I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He got away and I didn’t care. I almost died and all I could think about was you. I just want you.

utterance.speaker: MADDOX
utterance.content: Mr… Smith?

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: MADDOX
utterance.content: You’ve been a very hard man to find.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: MADDOX
utterance.content: You have some sensitive information about my employer. Information that you’ve been using to protect Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: Are you forgetting? We have a deal.

utterance.speaker: MADDOX
utterance.content: No. What you had was blackmail. Now, you’re going to tell me where all that information is. And after you do, I’m going to put Kate Beckett in the ground once and for all.
